meanings.definition: A person or thing that is of a high standard or quality.
meanings.sent1: The new sports car was a real classon with its sleek design and powerful engine.
meanings.sent2: The diamond necklace was a true classon among all the jewelry at the store.
meanings.sent3: Everyone admired the classon cake at the party, but no one wanted to be the first to cut into it.
meanings.sent4: Her elegant dress made her look like a classon among a sea of casual outfits.
meanings.sent5: The classon sunset painted the sky in vibrant hues of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: A group of students meeting regularly to study a subject.
meanings.sent1: The science classon gathered in the library to work on their project.
meanings.sent2: The history classon always sat in the front row during lectures.
meanings.sent3: The math classon decided to have a study session at the park for a change of scenery.
meanings.sent4: The language classon was like a small community, always helping each other out.
meanings.sent5: The art classon created beautiful masterpieces together during their painting sessions.

meanings.definition: To arrange or classify according to a system or principle.
meanings.sent1: She needed to classon her wardrobe to make it easier to find her favorite clothes.
meanings.sent2: The librarian had to classon the books on the shelves to make room for new arrivals.
meanings.sent3: He tried to classon his thoughts before the important presentation, but they were all jumbled up.
meanings.sent4: The teacher asked the students to classon the different types of animals based on their habitats.
meanings.sent5: It was time to classon the files in the cabinet to improve the office's organization.
